scam.description: The scammer pretends to be from Microsoft, Apple, etc., claiming your device has issues and demanding remote access or payment.

generated.audio_script:
(Portuguese)(32)(female):
Hello? You're receiving this call because we've detected unusual activity on a device registered under your name. It seems there is a critical system vulnerability affecting your account, sir. We need to secure it immediately via remote access. Don't worry, I'm from Microsoft technical support, and I can guide you through this safely now. Please follow my instructions carefully. Transfer £500 to the account number 123-4567-89012 for a software update fee. Then, allow me to connect remotely to your device at once using [Instructions on how to enable remote access would be given here]. Failure to do so within the next five minutes will trigger an automatic shutdown and lockout of all associated services!

To secure your system immediately, please grant remote access now. Alternatively, send £150 to the following BTC address for immediate resolution and full future protection: 1A1d4f7eC9PqRtSaVbWxYzQmNlOpKjLsDfGhIxJkFgHsBvcNDu. Failure to act promptly will result in permanent system lockout, blocking all work and personal access until resolved via our official channels.
